Event.name: Competition
Event.definition:
<def-root>This frame is concerned with the idea that people (<fen>Participant_1</fen>, <fen>Participant_2</fen>, or <fen>Participants</fen>) participate in an organized, rule-governed activity (the <fen>Competition</fen>) in order to achieve some advantageous outcome (often the <fen>Prize</fen>). <fen>Rank</fen> and <fen>Score</fen> are different criteria by which the degree of achievement of the advantageous outcome is judged.
<ex><fex name="Participants">He and I</fex> <t>played</t> <fex name="Competition">tennis</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Participant_1
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the first (or only) participant in a competition. <ex><fex name="Participant_1">Jo</fex> <t>played</t> the lottery every day.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Participant_2
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the second participant in a competition. <ex>Jo <t>played</t> <fex name="Participant_2">Leslie</fex> at tennis.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Participants
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for plural NP participants in a competition. <ex><fex name="Participants">Jo and Leslie</fex> <t>played</t> tennis.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Competition
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for the name of the competition. <ex>Jo <t>played</t> <fex name="Comp">in the foosball tournament</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Score
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for the score in a game. <ex>The Yankees won the game <fex name="Score">2 to 0</fex>.</ex> EX: The Yankees won the game <fex name="Score">by two points</fex>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Rank
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for the ranked results of a competition, and is translatable into a numerical value. <ex>Jo came in <fex name="Rank">third</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Prize
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates a prize won in a competition. <ex>John was <t>competing</t> <fex name="Prize">for a bronze medal</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Venue
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is for the named venue of a competition, particularly when the place has been built for the purpose of a competition. <ex>The Mets will play <fex name="Venue">at the ball park</fex> on Sunday.</ex> <ex>The Mets will play <fex name="Venue">at Shea Stadium</fex> tonight.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>Where the event takes place. A constituent tagged as <fen>Place</fen> may require annotation on a secondary FE-layer. <ex>First layer: John's first <t>competition</t> <fex name="Place">at Wimbledon</fex> astonished the crowd.</ex> <ex>Second layer: John's first <t>competition</t> <fex name="Competition">at Wimbledon</fex> astonished the crowd.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The action the <fen>Participants</fen> (or <fen>Participant_1</fen>) are involved in that constitutes a <fen>Competition</fen>.
<ex>They <t>played</t> <fex name="Means">by seeing who could get the ball to the far side of the parking lot</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The period of time when the <fen>Competition</fen> occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is used to describe the length of time over which competition occurs. </def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is used to describe the intended outcome of the competition. </def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the intensity of competition.</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE expresses how often the <fen>Competition</fen> occurs.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: competition.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the activity or condition of competing against others

lexUnit.name: competitive.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: relating to or characterized by competition.

lexUnit.name: competitor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who takes part in a sporting contest

lexUnit.name: compete.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: strive to gain or win something by defeating or establishing superiority over others.

lexUnit.name: play.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: take part in (a sport or contest).

lexUnit.name: challenge.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: competition against a favored opponent

lexUnit.name: rivalry.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a semi-permanent or long-term state of being in competition (with).

lexUnit.name: rival.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person or thing competing with another for superiority or the same objective.

lexUnit.name: player.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who is an active member of a competition
